required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Z-215 in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label, Crossover, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study of Z-215 Compared With Rabeprazole Sodium in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of Z-215 (10 mg, 20 mg, 40 mg) , compared with Rabeprazole Sodium (10 mg, 20 mg ) in Healthy Male Subjects. And to evaluate food-effect in Healthy Male Subjects administrated Z-215 20 mg.

primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of the measurements on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax: Maximum Plasma Concentration for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: tmax: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: t1/2: Terminal Elimination Half-life (t1/2) for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Lambda Z: Terminal Elimination Rate Constant (Lambda Z) for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-t: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-24: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time 0 to 24 hour for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-∞: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: CL/F: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CL/F) Pharmacokinetic Parameter for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Vd/F: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) Pharmacokinetic Parameter for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: MRT0-∞: Mean Residence Time from Time 0 to Infinity for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Rac(Cmax): Accumulation Index of Cmax (Rac(Cmax)) for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Rac(AUC): Accumulation Index of AUC (Rac(AUC)) for Z-215
primary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of pharmacokinetic parameters on Day1 and Day5 of administration are to be calculated by dose.

arm_group.description: 3-way cross-over, Z-215 10 mg/day / Z-215 20 mg/day / Rabeprazole Sodium 10 mg/day
3-way cross-over, Z-215 20 mg/day / Z-215 40 mg/day / Rabeprazole Sodium 20 mg/day
3-way cross-over, Z-215 20 mg/day (before breakfast) / Z-215 20 mg/day (after breakfast) / Rabeprazole Sodium 10 mg/day (after breakfast)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has negative results for H. pylori IgG antibody at screening.
- A body mass index 18.5≦BMI<25.0 kg/m^2 at screening.
- Able to understand the consent of the study and comply with the study. Able to give informed consent in writing before participating in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a history of PPI allergy.
- Has a history of drug or food serious allergy.
- Presently has or has a history of diseases that may affect evaluation of the study results such as gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, endocrine, blood, cardiovascular, mental or congenial metabolic disease.
- Has a history of surgery (such as resection of the liver, kidney, or digestive tract) that may affect the pharmacokinetics of the study drug.
- History of previous and current acid-related diseases.
- Received H. pylori eradication treatment within 6 months before screening.
- Has 450msec<QTC by Fridericia test at screening ECG .
- Has hypoacidity or anacidity. Or be determined that low gastric acid or no stomach acid by the gastric pH monitoring at baseline period.
- History or suspicion of drug, opioid, alcohol abuse or positive screening results.
- Use of any prescription drugs within 4 weeks prior to baseline period.
- Use of any over-the-counter drugs within 2 weeks prior to baseline period.
- Received blood transfusions within 12 weeks or donated ≥400mL of whole blood within 12 weeks or ≥200mL of whole blood within 4 weeks prior to baseline period. Donated platelet or plasma within 2 weeks prior to baseline period.
